title: Input Embedding-Customer Support Chatbot
description:
You are building a Customer Support Chatbot.  The chatbot should identify whether two customer queries have similar meaning even if they use different words.
 [hINT:  use sentence embeddings and compare them with cosine similarity].

Sample Input Sentences
"I need a refund for my order"
"How do I reset my password?"
"What is the weather in New York?"
"Please cancel my subscription"
"I want to return my shoes"

Expected Output
Embedding Vector Shape: torch.Size([5, 384])
Similarity [Refund vs Return Shoes]: 0.xxx
Similarity [Refund vs Reset Password]: 0.xxx
Similarity [Password vs Cancel Subscription]: 0.xxx

test_cases.input:
"I need a refund for my order"
"How do I reset my password?"
"What is the weather in New York?"
"Please cancel my subscription"
"I want to return my shoes"
test_cases.output:
Embedding Vector Shape: torch.Size([5, 384])
Similarity [Refund vs Return Shoes]: 0.485
Similarity [Refund vs Reset Password]: 0.229
Similarity [Password vs Cancel Subscription]: 0.294

title: Input Embeddings â€“ Customer Support Chatbot
description:
A customer support chatbot should identify when different queries mean the same thing. Use embeddings to check similarity.
Sample Input Sentences
"I need a refund for my order"
"How do I reset my password?"
"What is the weather in New York?"
"Please cancel my subscription"
"I want to return my shoes"

Expected Output
Embedding Shape: torch.Size([5, 384])
Refund vs Return: 0.xxx
Refund vs Password: 0.xxx
Password vs Cancel: 0.xxx

test_cases.input:
"I need a refund for my order",
"How do I reset my password?",
"What is the weather in New York?",
"Please cancel my subscription",
"I want to return my shoes"
test_cases.output:
Embedding Shape: torch.Size([5, 384])
Refund vs Return: 0.485
Refund vs Password: 0.229
Password vs Cancel: 0.294

title: Input Embedding- Movie Recommendation System
description:
Scenario
A movie app wants to group similar user queries using embeddings.
Sample Input Sentences
    1. "I want to watch a scary movie"
    2. "Show me a horror film"
    3. "Play some comedy shows"
    4. "Find me a thriller movie"
    5. "Give me a documentary"

Expected Output
Embedding Shape: torch.Size([5, 384])
Scary Movie vs Horror Film: 0.xxx
Scary Movie vs Comedy Shows: 0.xxx
Horror Film vs Thriller Movie: 0.xxx

test_cases.input:
1. "I want to watch a scary movie"
    2. "Show me a horror film"
    3. "Play some comedy shows"
    4. "Find me a thriller movie"
    5. "Give me a documentary"
test_cases.output:
Embedding Shape: torch.Size([5, 384])
Scary Movie vs Horror Film: 0.628
Scary Movie vs Comedy Shows: 0.236
Horror Film vs Thriller Movie: 0.666
